Experiment Method.Assay Method: Confocal Microscopy for Autophagy and Mitochondrial Density

Material used.Material Name: Primary cortical neurons, midbrain neurons, PC12 cells
Material used.Description: Primary cultures of rat cortical cells from neonatal Wistar rats, mesencephalic neurons from mouse embryos at embryonic day 15, and PC12 cell line were used.

Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of mutant A53T alpha-synuclein led to increased autophagic activity, enhanced mitochondrial removal, net mitochondrial loss, and bioenergetic deficit in neurons.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple dishes and samples were analyzed per group (e.g., at least 15 cell bodies or 18 axonal fragments per group for autophagy measurements).

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Control neurons without A53T alpha-synuclein overexpression were used as a baseline for comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Scrambled shRNA plasmids were used as controls in shRNA experiments.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: D'Agostino-Pearson omnibus test for normality, followed by Mann-Whitney, Student's t-test, one-way ANOVA with Newman-Keuls posthoc test, Kruskal-Wallis with Dunn's test, and two-way ANOVA for interactions.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial density and autophagosome numbers comparable to control neurons (e.g., mitochondrial density of 0.366 ± 0.022 in axons of control midbrain neurons).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant decrease in mitochondrial density (e.g., 0.275 ± 0.011 in axons of midbrain neurons overexpressing A53T alpha-synuclein) and increased autophagosome numbers compared to control.

Material used.Description: Cells were lysed for protein extraction and analysis of autophagic markers like LC3-I/II and p62.

Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of A53T alpha-synuclein enhanced LC3-I cleavage into LC3-II and increased turnover of p62/SQSTM1, indicating increased autophagic activity.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Control neurons without A53T alpha-synuclein overexpression were used for comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Paired t-test for densitometric analysis of immunoreactive bands.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: LC3-II/LC3-I ratio and p62 levels comparable to control neurons.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in LC3-II/LC3-I ratio and decrease in p62 levels compared to control neurons.

Material used.Description: Cortical neurons were transfected with plasmids expressing firefly and Renilla luciferase for ATP level estimation.

Readout description.Result Description: A 15% decrease in relative ATP levels was observed in neurons overexpressing mutant A53T alpha-synuclein.

Biological replicates.Description: Sixteen independent samples were analyzed in all experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Control neurons without A53T alpha-synuclein overexpression were used for comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test for comparing ATP levels between control and A53T alpha-synuclein overexpressing neurons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: ATP levels comparable to control neurons.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant decrease in ATP levels (e.g., 15% reduction) compared to control neurons.

Material used.Description: Neurons were co-transfected with a fusion protein connecting Gal4 DNA binding domain with PGC-1α, along with a Gal4-UAS-luciferase reporter.

Readout description.Result Description: A53T alpha-synuclein increased PGC-1α transcriptional activity by approximately 80%, indicating a bioenergetic deficit.

Biological replicates.Description: At least eight independent samples were analyzed per group.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Control neurons without A53T alpha-synuclein overexpression were used for comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test for comparing PGC-1α activity between control and A53T alpha-synuclein overexpressing neurons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: PGC-1α transcriptional activity comparable to control neurons.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in PGC-1α transcriptional activity (e.g., ~80% increase) compared to control neurons.
